solution_line_template: Niko will earn ${cost_per_pair_socks} x {profit_percent_num}/{percent_divisor} = $<<{cost_per_pair_socks}*{profit_percent_num}/{percent_divisor}={profit_per_first_four_pair}>>{profit_per_first_four_pair} profit for each of the first four pairs of socks.

So, his total profit for the four pairs of socks will be ${profit_per_first_four_pair} x {num_first_four_pairs} = $<<{profit_per_first_four_pair}*{num_first_four_pairs}={total_profit_first_four_pairs}>>{total_profit_first_four_pairs}.

His total earnings for the {num_other_five_pairs} pairs of socks is ${profit_per_other_pair} x {num_other_five_pairs} = $<<{profit_per_other_pair}*{num_other_five_pairs}={total_profit_other_five_pairs}>>{total_profit_other_five_pairs}.

Therefore, his total profit will be ${total_profit_first_four_pairs} + ${total_profit_other_five_pairs} = $<<{total_profit_first_four_pairs}+{total_profit_other_five_pairs}={total_profit}>>{total_profit}.
